page.title: 16Recreation (see also clubs)
page.content: Approximately 60% of people questioned belonged to some organized group in the community. Most were members of the community council or of one of the religious groups. 30% of the sample would enter produce or exhibits at the flower show. Most householders have a flower garden & many a vegetable patch. Only 19% have orchards or greenhouses. The greatest number (430) belonged to the Community Council. The Horticultural Society claimed 100 members, the Happy Hours 70, Womens' Institute 45, Indoor Bowls and Snooker 40 each, Cricket & Football Clubs 25 each & Badminton 12. Some families attend Adult Education Classes at local centres or use Sports Halls nearby. HOLIDAYS: Of the sample 24% holidayed last year (84) in Suffolk; 40% elsewhere in Britain; 22% abroad; 14% took no holiday.
